or, having re-read your post properly it is probably an issue with a mismat=
ch between the serialised population and the innovation database which trac=
ks the innovations throughout the run.  I would try serialising the Innovat=
ion database aswell and then loading both objects at startup.

Let me know =
how it tuns out.

Cheers

Matt

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "vincedx15" <v=
ince15@...> wrote:
>
> Hi, I'm working with neat4j but I need to make it st=
oppable in order to resume an evolution later. I did it saving the serializ=
ation of the population object. The evolution starts and moves through epoc=
hs. Unfortunately I'm experiencing a problem in the NEATSpecieManager class=
. From line 49:
> 
> if (applicantGenes[applicantIdx] instanceof NEATLinkGe=
ne) {
> 	weightDiffTotal +=3D (((NEATLinkGene)applicantGenes[applicantIdx])=
.getWeight() - ((NEATLinkGene)repGenes[repIdx]).getWeight());
> }
> 
> The =
sum of weightDiffTotal at line 50 looks at the weight property of NEATLinkG=
ene or NEATNodeGene, because Genes can be both Links and Nodes. 
> Unfortun=
ately, for some reason, sometimes, I get a ClassCastException because it ca=
sts the object to a Link even if it's a Node.
> The applicantIdx as a certa=
in value... let's say, 80, while repIdx is 1.
> To solve this I simply catc=
h the exception and skip the instruction... and I know that this is bad! Th=
at's why I'm here.
> Should i change the cast and comprare Links with Nodes=
? To be honest... i'm not really sure of what's going on here.
> 
> I hope =
you can help me. Thanks!
>
